intro: Aeschynomene minutiflora subsp. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, small leaves and showy, pink to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields, and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it beneficial for soil enrichment in agricultural settings.
